snippet: Campbell Barracks in Heidelberg, Germany, which, as the headquarters of the United States Army in Europe, issued the orders for millions of American soldiers, closed on Friday.
abstract: Campbell Barracks in Heidelberg, Germany, which has served as headquarters of the United States Army in Europe since end of World War II and until recently as NATO central command, closes with little fanfare; Army moves headquarters to Wiesbaden, where base is more isolated and meets post-9/11 security requirements.
lead_paragraph: Campbell Barracks in Heidelberg, Germany, which, as the headquarters of the United States Army in Europe, issued the orders for millions of American soldiers, closed on Friday.

headline.main: Storied U.S. Barracks Closes With Little Fanfare
headline.print_headline: Storied U.S. Barracks Closes With Little Fanfare
